goal.ch: This course will introduce students the basic knowledge of diffraction, scattering and reflection, as well as other related techniques, of X-ray photons and neutrons. The applications of these techniques will also be the focus of this course. In addition, we will introduce the concepts of condensed matter physics wherever it is appropriate, to further strengthen the horizon and depth of the applications side of the course. The topics selected for this course is aimed for the grad students who have been working or will work on X-ray/neutron diffraction/scattering/reflection-related researches. Nevertheless, undergrad students who are interested in these topics are also welcome.

outline.ch:
1. Interactions of matter and photons/neutrons
2. Sources of photons and neutrons
3. Symmetry and crystal structure
4. Refraction and reflection from interfaces
5. Kinematic theory of diffraction
6. Dynamic theory of diffraction
7. Resonant scattering
8. Elastic neutron scattering
9. Inelastic neutron scattering
